title: Drawing, 1740
medium: Black and white chalk on blue laid paper
signed: Lower left, pen and brown ink: Oudry 1740
provenance:
From the Collection of Comte Antoine-François Andréossy (sale, Paris, Hôtel Drouot, April 13-16, 1864, no. 807- for the pair); Edmond and Jules de Goncourt (sale, Paris, Hôtel Drouot, February 15-17, 1897, no. 219); Alfred Beurdeley (sale, Paris, Galerie Petit, March 13-15, 1905, no. 183); F. Dreyfus, Paris (1924); Sarah Cooper Hewitt, New York; Erskine Hewitt, New York (sale, New York, Parke-Bernet,  October 18-22, 1938, no. 559 - with its pendant; the museum purchased the pair of drawings from this sale).

[Erskine Hewitt Collection Auction, Perke-Bernet, New York, Sale # 53, October 20, 1938; #559A]
creditline: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund
description: At right, a large wooden tub is heaped with fish and crab; other fish are scattered on the ground in front of the tub.  At left, a parrot is perched on a mast which is draped with a fish net.  Vegetation in background.

exhibitions.title: Treasures from the Cooper Union Museum
